originalTitle: More than 160 churchgoers kidnapped in twin Nigeria attacks - clergy
title: Friends Helping Friends in Nigeria
content:
Hello, my amazing friends! I'm your special news reporter from beautiful Africa. Today, we're going to talk about something that happened in a place called Nigeria, which is a big country in Africa, just like our home! Sometimes, sad things happen, but it's important to understand them with kind hearts. We also learn about the brave people who help when things are difficult.

A Special Day in Nigeria

Imagine it's a sunny Sunday morning. Many families in a town called Kurmin Wali in Nigeria were getting ready for a special time. They were going to church. A church is a building where people go to pray, sing songs, and learn good stories. It's a place where friends and families meet to share peace and happiness. It’s like a big family gathering! Did you know? Nigeria is a country in West Africa. It has many different languages and cultures, and it's famous for its music and movies!

What Happened on Sunday?

On this particular Sunday, something not so good happened. While people were quietly praying and listening to stories in two churches, some unkind people came. These unkind people are sometimes called 'gangs'. They are groups of people who do things that are not good or kind. They came into the churches and took some of the people away. When someone is taken away without their permission, we say they are 'kidnapped'. This means they were taken by force, and it made many people sad and worried. More than 160 grown-ups and maybe some children were taken. This happened in a place called Kaduna state. A 'state' is like a big region or area within a country.

Why Do People Go to Church?

People go to church for many reasons. They go to feel close to God, to listen to inspiring messages, and to be with their community. It's a place for hope and love. It’s also a place where people help each other. They share food, smiles, and sometimes even hugs. It's a place where everyone tries to be their best self. Did you know? There are many different kinds of churches all over Africa, and people also go to mosques and other places of worship to pray and be together!

Who Are the Helpers?

When something sad like this happens, there are many good people who step in to help. The police are very important helpers. The police are like special guardians in our towns and cities. Their job is to keep everyone safe and to help when bad things happen. They wear uniforms and have special cars. In Nigeria, the police are working very hard right now. They are looking for the people who were taken and trying to find the unkind people who did this. They want to bring everyone home safely. This is a very big and important job, and they are working day and night.

Looking for Our Friends

The police, along with other community leaders, are doing everything they can. They are talking to people, looking for clues, and exploring the area. Many people in Nigeria and all over Africa are praying for the safe return of these friends and neighbours. They hope they will be back with their families very soon. It's like when you lose your favourite toy, and everyone helps you look for it until you find it again. But this is much more important because it's about people.

Keeping Our Communities Safe

When we hear news like this, it's natural to feel a little worried. But it's important to remember that most places in Africa, and all over the world, are safe. These kinds of bad things don't happen every day. There are always many more good people than bad people in the world. Our leaders and helpers work hard to make sure our schools, homes, and churches are safe places for everyone. Did you know? Being kind to your neighbours and friends helps make your community stronger and safer for everyone!

How Can We Help?

Even though we are far away, we can help by sending kind thoughts and wishes to the people in Nigeria. We can also learn to be kind and helpful in our own communities. Remember to always listen to your grown-ups about staying safe. They teach you important rules like not talking to strangers and always staying with your family. Sharing a smile, helping a friend, or saying a kind word can make a big difference in making our world a better place, one small step at a time.

Hope for Tomorrow

We know that the police and brave helpers are working tirelessly. We believe that with everyone's efforts, the people who were taken will come home. Stories like this remind us how important it is for everyone to work together and look out for each other. That's what a strong community does! Let’s send our biggest hopes and kindest wishes to the families in Kurmin Wali. We hope they will be reunited soon, with happy smiles and warm hugs. Did you know? Africa is a continent with 54 countries! It is full of amazing animals, beautiful landscapes, and vibrant cultures.

Our African Family

We are all part of one big African family. When one part of our family faces a challenge, we all care and send our support. Let’s remember to always choose kindness, help those in need, and believe in the good that is all around us. Stay curious, stay kind, and stay safe, my little explorers!
summary: In Nigeria, kind helpers are working hard to find families who were sadly taken from their churches, so they can return home safely.
whyMatters: It's important because everyone deserves to feel safe and happy, especially in places where they go to pray and be with their community.

originalTitle: Drums, chants and celebrations as Ethiopians mark the baptism of Jesus
title: Drums, chants and celebrations as Ethiopians mark the baptism of Jesus

originalTitle: Italian fashion designer Valentino dies aged 93
title: Italian fashion designer Valentino dies aged 93
content: One of the giants of 20th century fashion, his creations were worn by celebrities including Elizabeth Taylor, Julia Roberts and Gwyneth Paltrow.

title: Is a Panenka ever the right choice for a penalty?
content: Following Morocco's last-minute spot-kick miss in the Africa Cup of Nations final, BBC Sport asks if a Panenka is ever the right choice for a penalty.

originalTitle: Under-pressure Frank 'feeling trust' of Spurs board
title: Under-pressure Frank 'feeling trust' of Spurs board
content: Tottenham head coach Thomas Frank says lunch with board members is an "extremely good sign" despite pressure mounting on him during an underwhelming season.
